blocks.value: The Thrones, also called "Ophanim" or "Wheels," are the third choir of angels. They are called Thrones because they are the living throne of God's justice and authority. These angels are known for their humility and submission to God's will.

The Thrones carry out God's judgments and make His justice manifest. They are channels through which God's grace flows to the lower choirs. Ezekiel's vision describes them as great wheels covered with eyes, symbolizing God's all-seeing providence and just judgment (Ezekiel 1:15-21).
The Thrones teach us the importance of humility, justice, and complete submission to God's will in our lives.
